history.content:
I am taking 61c right now (with 168 and 170) and took 70 last semester (with EE16B and an IEOR upper div). I think 61c and 70 are both hard classes that require a lot of time. So 70 has weekly psets. 61c starts super hectic, having at least an assignment per week (sometimes two, as hws and projects might clash) + weekly lab. Later, 61c pace is a bit slower, but at least the first half of the semester you will find yourself with few time for yourself. If you can take them separately I think it'd be better for you. If you are not EECS and trying to declare, I would recommend not taking them together.

----------

Another perspective-- I am currently taking 61c and 70 together and am finding the two manageable. During project crunches for 61c you will have to manage your time wisely to keep up with 70 psets, but as long as you take advantage of resources and work hard you should be alright. That said, I do agree with the response above in that if you are worried about declaring you should take them one at a time so you can dedicate more time to focusing on doing very well in 70.

I am taking 61c right now (with 168 and 170) and took 70 last semester (with EE16B and an IEOR upper div). I think 61c and 70 are both hard classes that require a lot of time. So 70 has weekly psets. 61c starts super hectic, having at least an assignment per week (sometimes two, as hws and projects might clash) + weekly lab. Later, 61c pace is a bit slower, but at least the first half of the semester you will find yourself with few time for yourself. If you can take them separately I think it'd be better for you. If you are not EECS and trying to declare, I would recommend not taking them together.
I'm considering taking CS70 and CS61C together next semester? Thoughts? Advice? Anything helps!
history.subject: CS70 and CS61C
